Name: Play Like A Champion Boardgame
Description:
Each player starts his / her own penalty area, aiming at the enemy from 16 meters out. As you come through a good question to answer, divided into six categories and three levels. Throwing of two dice determines how difficult (or easy) the question and the category is. Got a question correctly, you may continue to dribble on the basis of the direction that the back of the card prescribes. 
In addition you must think carefully about the choices you make, because you can get a red or yellow card. An injury makes you one turn to watch from the dug-out, a yellow card forces you to skip a turn. If you collect two yellow cards or a direct red then you move back to your own penalty area and from there to set up a new attack. 
If you reach the penalty area of your opponent and you answer the question correctly, then you score a goal and you have won.

Name: el Desierto: el Tesoro del Tuareg
Description:
"el Desierto" is game for 2 to 6 players where all try to find the tuareg's treasure. One player manages the tuareg pieces and the rest are explorer looking for clues in different cities. When they draw the right cards, they can do an excavation and look one of eight treasure locations (represented by eight face down cards). When a player believes to know where the treasure is hidden, he moves his piece to that location and do an excavation; if it's correct he wins the game. The tuareg player have different rules to move his camel pieces and also can obstruct other players actions.

From the back of the box art: "Hace mucho tiempo los tuaregs, tribu nómada del desierto del Sáhara, encontraron una gran parte del legendario tesoro del Rey Salomón, regalo de la Reina de Saba. El hallazgo fue por casualidad, mientras excavaban buscando un pozo enterrado por una tormenta de arena. La codicia que tal tesoro despertó consiguió romper la armonía que hasta entonces reinaba entre este pueblo del desierto. Muchos tuaregs murieron por culpa del antiguo tesoro y Halim el Sabio, Señor de las duna, quedó tan apenado que mandó a sus súbditos que enterraran el tesoro de nuevo en el desierto. Hombre previsor, Halim pensó que quizás en el futuro el tesoro podría ser útil a su pueblo, así que esparció pistas falsas y verdaderas por todo el desierto, para que solo él o sus descendientes superan el lugar donde el tesoro estaba enterrado. Pero sucedió que su bisnieto Al Denir, el Bienmandado murió sin descendencia, y el tesoro de los tuaregs y su situación se convirtió con el tiempo en tan solo una leyenda, una historia para contar junto al fuego las largas y frías noches del desierto..."

Name: The Great Walleye Tournament Board Game
Description:
The object of the game is to proceed from the marina, trying to avoid the Red Hazard Squares in the channel on the way to the Lake where you will fish.

The Lake consists of the six fishing areas, as related to actual Walleye fishing.  Here each player can participate in simulated angling.

Each player or team is required to catch one weighted Walleye in each of the six areas before returning to the marina on their way back players try to finish first avoiding the Red Hazard Squares, as well as the Special Weight Deduction circles.

The tournament champion is the player or team which holds the greatest total weight for their six Walleye.

(Taken from the back of the box)

Name: Charlie Chaplin Card Game
Description:
An "educational" card game by Bubbles Inc. Published in 1972. A rummy game featuring Charlie Chaplin imagery.

The game play is that of a basic rummy game. Seven card hands are dealt, runs of three with matching suit are required by the rules. The winner is the first to finish their hand.

The suits are related to Charlie Chaplin's general image; Canes, Shoes (untied), Neckties, and Hats.

This game is interesting because the card backs are unique to each card. This theoretically enables a player to memorize the deck. Each card is unique because it has a flip book of Charlie Chaplin on the card backs. He is twirling his cane. Each card is numbered on the back so that the flip book movie can be played in order.

Name: TurfMaster Course Collection 3
Description:
The third collection of extra courses for TurfMaster.

This expansion was created for AZA Spiele's 10th Anniversary, and includes one additional track: Kentucky.  It is available for free download from the AZA Spiele website in their download area.

Name: The Ten Condiments
Description:
Ketchup with a big combo and relish your victory.

Chain together your condiments to make custom sauces and slather them over meals they'd taste the best on. Hoard your condiments to bust out a massive chain at the end of the game for mega points.

Each condiment links to three other condiments. Link together several condiments to make big points, or play one or two at a time to build up your saucy reserves. The elusive eleventh condiment and the sauce monster can make your combos even bigger. The unique card drawing mechanic makes your condiment stockpile vary wildly throughout the game. Read the ingredients to find out what is REALLY in horseradish (hint: it does not contain horse or radish) or plan your next brilliant concoction, it is up to you. Just don't get caught with a bunch of unused packets at the end.

Game includes:

* 30 Menu Items
    * 54 Condiment Cards
    * Instructions

You will need:

* A notepad and pencil for keeping score

Warning: This game may make you hungry.

(source: publisher's website: http://www.stonetabletgames.com/10Cdetail.html )

Name: Deflections
Description:
A two player abstract strategy game played on a hex grid board that represents a gladiator pit. Players fire "projectiles" (represented by red arrowheads) from the central space trying to hit their opponent's pawn. These projectiles reflect or deflect off the arena walls and "shields" that the players can slot into the board on their turn in lieu of movement. Projectiles that finish their normal movement in the same space multiply and move off in different directions. Projectiles that finish in the same space after this secondary movement detonate removing themselves and all adjacent shields. Play continues until one or both players is hit by a projectile, resulting in a loss for the hit player or a draw if both are hit on the same turn.

--user summary

Name: Art Express
Description:
Art Express is a mix between a drawing game and a reflex game where everyone plays together.

A game unfolds as follows:

Each player receives a card on which are recorded seven common names, a name compounded, and a verb phrase. For the first round, participants will have to draw in less than 30 seconds the first word of their card.

The start is given through the hourglass, and when a player has finished his drawing, he returns his paper and rushes to catch one of the chips placed in the center of the table by focusing on the strongest. Once the time fully elapsed, latecomers should stop drawing and rushing on the chips.

All drawings will now be unveiled simultaneously and each participant can take one he thinks he can guess. Each player wins the number of points indicated on the token, if and only if an opponent manages to guess the drawing. To avoid distortion, the person who guesses also pockets of points, so no cheating!

The following rounds are conducted in the same manner as the first and the game ends when each participant drew all the words of his card. At the end, the player with the most points is declared the winner.

Name: Bonehead
Description: The goal in Bone Head is to draw cards with proposed choices and vote for the worst way to handle them. If your card says: "The Most Bone headed Choice for a Marriage Counselor," will you vote for Tony Soprano, Britney Spears, or Mike Tyson? Get the party going with a game of bad (and worse) ideas that will have everyone roaring with laughter. With 3 color-coded category card piles (Bone headed Things, Bone headed People, and Boneheaded Ideas), corresponding choice cards, a colorful board, and turkey game pieces, this funny board game will entertain your friends for hours.

Name: Disney Fairies Tinkerbell Springtime in Pixie Hollow Game
Description:
From the back of the box:
It's springtime in Pixie Hollow, and Tinker Bell and the rest of the Disney fairies want to make their gardens sparkle! Help them gather flowers, berries, and creatures to take care of. Players try to match their cards to the three pictures on the fairy pawns. If you only have two of the items in your hand, you can ask your friend for the third! Once you have a match, you get to take the fairy pawn and put it in front of you. The player that collects the most pawns wins the game!

-Includes 7 Pixie Hollow Fairy Pawns & Stands, 28 Cards and Instructions
-For ages 5+
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

Name: Warzone: Beasts of War
Description:
From the back of the book:

GLORY TO THE BRAVE!

"The roar of the Necromower's twin diesels was deafening as it cruised the desert landscape in search of prey. Within moments, its Wolfbane driver spotted a familiar yet horrifying outline against the horizon - a pair of Pretorian Stalkers leading an assault group of Legionnaires, Necromutants and Centurions. Without a second of doubt, the driver turned his beast of war to face the new threat..."

WARZONE COMPENDIUM 2 is the second official supplement for WARZONE - the dast and furious techno-fantasy miniatures game. Included are:
- VEHICLE RULES for use in your Warzone game. Have your Capitolian Purple Sharks strafe the Dark Legion scum in the venusian jungles, or your Necromower squads cut blody swathes of destruction through ranks of Legionnaires in the martian deserts. Beast of War includes full stats and descriptions of ten vehicles, including the Mishimese Dragonbike, the TA6500, the Imperial Necromower and Twin Barracudas, and the Brotherhood Death Angel.
  The vehicle rules have been designed specifically to capture the fast and furious atmosphere of Warzone, and works in small skirmishes and large all out battles alike.
- NEW TROOPS, including large sections of the Secret Kohorts - the heretic forces of Algeroth - and the Imperial Clans' numerous special forces.
- RULES UPDATES, clarifications and additions.
- VEHICLE REFERENCE CARDS and a new template.
- NEW WEAPONS for use with or without vehicles.

Get ready to enter your Beasts of War!

Name: Domino met de muis
Description: This game, based on the German animated series Sendung mit der Maus, is similar to Picture Dominoes. However, instead of matching numbers, players have to match pictures of objects with pictures of the Mouse using those objects.

Name: Snack Street
Description:
Officail description from Wit Mine Games:

"Snack street" is a light auction game for 2-6 players.

Several snacks businessmen, launched a fierce scramble of the ownership of snack stores on the Snack Streetï¼Œin order to sell snacks to the gluttonous customers and made enormous profits……

As a businessman,players have to manage both the snacks stock, and the acquisition of stores at reasonable prices.

At the end of the game ,certain snacks will be sold in the corresponding snack store and will score for the owner!Also be careful !If one don't have the corresponding snack store,that kind of snacks will rot and caused economic losses!

Players who end with the highest score will win the game and become the commercial giant of Snack Street!

Name: Please Stand By
Description:
From Publishers Website:
Please Stand By is a quick and easy to learn rules system for fast paced tabletop miniature gaming. Game play can be enhanced with special and advanced rules that players can incorporate into their games. Please Stand By gives you the opportunity to play in almost any genre or era from your favorite zombie settings. Seven different scenarios and multiple objectives make for a unique and different game experience each time you play.

Name: Monopoly: Mini Edition
Description:
This is a series of pocket-sized Monopoly games with cartoon themes: there is a Pokemon themed set and a Ben 10 themed set at least. There's also a plain, unthemed version.
The sets use small cardboard pieces and a thick cardboard board. Instead of dice, a 'digital roulette' is provided - a spinner with numbers from 1 to 12. The properties are capital cities of various countries and instead of railway stations, you get airport stations.  The rest of the board is similar to conventional Monopoly.

The themes only affect the box design and the centre of the board and don't have any bearing on the game itself. No publisher is identified, though the back of the box does indicate it is made in China.

Name: Baby Hunt
Description:
Find your baby, play as 1 of 4 animals. For children of all ages but aimed at children of about 2 to about 6. The Fun Factor is high for that age group, unless you are playing with your child and teaching them how to play Baby Hunt. This game teaches children how to use color recognition, take turns, keep secrets, use strategy, and much more.

Each player places their Animal of choice at the animals home base, each animal has its own home base. The babies are placed in their places, each also has its own place. The game is then ready to play with players rolling the die and moving to the space that they rolled, each player gets a turn. No one knows whose baby is whose until a player has reached one of the four babies and takes a peek, that player and only that player knows if the baby is theirs or if it belongs to someone else. Once a player find their baby the player then races for the home position.

Name: Bogeyman
Description:
"Fast and Furious Family Fun!" (box)

12 Players - 3 of 4 colours - race around the board while being chased by the purple Bogeyman. Choose to either take the long route and be safe, or take the short route and risk being sent back to start by the Bogeyman. (User description)

Name: Rhymation
Description:
Rhymation is a game of word communication in which players attempt to communicate rhyming words to their teammates.

Blue spaces require teams to guess a list of 4 rhyming words (i.e. chance, pants, romance, lance) within 30 seconds.

Yellow spaces challenge teams to guess 3 different one-syllable rhyming pairs (i.e. church perch, fun sun, your tour) within 30 seconds.

Red spaces give teams 30 seconds to guess 2 multi-syllable rhyming pairs (sincere cashier, construction reduction).

Grey spaces are "showdown" spaces, in which each team nominates one team member to compete. The chosen players are given one word and must alternate naming as many rhyming words as possible, until one player either repeats a word, gives a word that doesn't rhyme, or takes more than 5 seconds.

The first team to reach the "high noon" space at the top of the board and win a final showdown is declared the champion.

Name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs Game
Description: This is a card game with four suits - Triangles, Circles, Squares and Stars.  The miniature cards feature illustrations from Snow White - Snow White, each of the dwarfs, the Huntsman, the Wicked Queen, the Witch, the Prince.  Points are scored by laying down runs of cards.  Points are lost if you then have to pick up tricks.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Pinocchio Game
Description:
This is a trick-taking game for four players.

From the back of the box:
Each player is dealt 11 cards and the last 4 cards are laid in the center of the table.  The player to the left of the dealer estimates how many tricks he thinks he can take, and the highest bidder may substitute any or all of the 4 cards in the center for his 4 lowest cards.  Taking the four lowest cards from his hand he lays them down in front of him as one trick and then leads a card.  Each of the other players in turn plays a higher card if possible and the one who plays the card with the highest number takes the trick. The winner then leads a card from his hand.  If the highest bidder doesn't get the number of tricks he bid, he will have that amount deducted from his score.  All other players get one point for each trick they take.  The first player to get 50 points wins the game.

The miniature cards have illustrations on them from Pinocchio.  The instructions are written on the back of the box.  The cards range in number from 1 to 11 with fewer cards for each number as the number increases:

7 copies of #1 featuring Monstro
6 copies of #2 featuring Lampwick
6 copies of #3 featuring The Coachman
5 copies of #4 featuring Stromboli
5 copies of #5 featuring Fox and Cat
4 copies of #6 featuring Figaro
4 copies of #7 featuring Cleo
4 copies of #8 featuring Jiminy Cricket
4 copies of #9 featuring Geppetto
2 copies of #10 featuring The Blue Fairy
1 copy of #11 featuring Pinocchio

The illustrations are copyright W.D.P. [Walt Disney Pictures].  This is Volume 2 in a series.

Name: Ancient Historical Battles, Volume 2
Description:
This books describes 40 battle scenarios during the ancient period, from Acragas in 406BC to Yarmuk in 636 AD.  Each scenario is given on one page.  Troop order of battle is described for use by De Bellis Antiquitatis/Multitudinus (DBA/M).  The author gives the number of men represented by each stand, so it should be simple to adapt the scenarios to other rule sets.

Example:  Early Macedonian army at Crocus Plain:
"20000 Foot: 8 Auxilia (5 I(I), 3 R(O)), 6 Psiloi I(O), 6 Spear R(O)
3000 Mounted: 1 Knight R(F), 2 Cavalry R(O)
1 General Knight R(F)"

Name: Pippi pluttifikationsspel
Description:
This game is set in a Pippi Longstocking theme and is intended to be a used for multiplication training of children.

The games consists of two decks of cards. One deck with simple multiplication questions like 5x5 or 1x3. The other deck is answer cards with text like =25 or =3. At the start of the game, each player is dealt a number of question. The answer cards are placed in a heap on the table. The goal of the game is to score points by making pairs of question cards and answer cards.

Pluttifikation is Pippis word for multiplication.

Name: Galactic worms
Description:
Everywhere in the galaxy enormous worms are crunching and eating themselfes through the universe, sometimes even the "eternal carrot gods" will intervine.

Galactic worms is a 2-6 player fast-paced games where there can only be one worm when the universe is totally destroyed.

Aim of the game: each player starts with some worm parts and tries to eat as many planets as they can, and play out carrotcards/battlecards/"eternal carrot god" cards against each other.

When all planets are eaten it´s time to kill of other players until there is only one left.

When you destroy enemies you get some of their planets, when only one player is left it´s time to count who has most points. Count: eaten body parts, planets, and the length of the winner worm in play.

Game components: 
1 psychedelic map 64x64cm ( with art by Peter Stenberg)
2 dice, more than 30 worm tiles, 45+ carrot cards, planets. + bonus stuff included.

Expansion is also planned at the end of 2010
Also tournament rules + experience point system will be included.

Name: The Tarot of the Black Cat
Description: Each player has the tarot cards on hand. The start player declare a number from 1 to 22. It is discarded by the player that has the card of the number. The turn is played clockwise. If the player is no hand, the player is removed in this game. The last player is the winner.

Name: EMPIRES: Fate of a World
Description:
How does an empire grow from a nomadic tribe of spear-wielding cave people into the greatest civilization of all? Is an empire forged though might and battle? Through enlightenment and culture? Or through the amassing of great and undeniable wealth?

The course of history is up to you!  Guide your empire from its beginnings into a futuristic nation of leaders!  Wipe out any who stand in your way, or absorb their territories into yours!

EMPIRES: Fate of a World is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players where each player represents a civilization in its infancy,  owning nothing more than a small settlement and an explorer unit.  Through the use of Development Cards (Archery, Railroads, Robotics, and the like), players sculpt their civilizations.  Over time, settlements become cities, explorers give way to armies, and eventually, one Empire will emerge as the greatest of all!

EMPIRES: Fate of a World is played out on a world map board, with wooden tokens representing settlements, cities, and units.  In addition, each player has a development mat where he or she plays Development Cards that shape the Empire.  How a player achieves victory is completely up to them: Wealth, Culture, or Might.

—description from the designer

Name: 18 Ghosts
Description:
For half a millennium, a group of ghosts have been growing quite weary of one another's company in an old Scottish castle.

Since they are thoroughly bored with the social scene of the stony structure, each ghost secretly wishes to escape the castle and go on wild adventures. Unfortunately, the ghosts are trapped there.

Suddenly, an opportunity arises! They discover three glimmering magical portals that they might be able to use to find freedom. Desperation sets in quickly, because they know the portals won't be open long, so the ghosts scramble and jostle one another, trying to slip through the portals while they have the chance. They certainly don't want to see each other's ethereal faces for another 500 years!

COMPONENTS:

18 Ghosts includes:


     A board depicting an old Scottish castle with 25 rooms (5×5) and one large dungeon.
     18 ghosts in 2 types and 3 colors (3 for each color and type).
     3 portals, one of each color.


GOAL OF THE GAME:

Both players try to help their ghosts escape from the castle.

In order to win the game, be the first to have a red ghost, a blue ghost, and a yellow ghost outside the castle.

When this happens, the game ends immediately. That player is the winner.

Name: Target Gotland
Description:
This is a Cold War era game depicting the hypothetical Soviet invasion of this strategically located Swedish island in the Baltic Sea. Includes five small (8.5" x 11") unmounted mapsheets and 300 unmounted counters. Originally published in issue #6 of the Swedish wargame magazine Combat!.

(c)1978 by Wellington Wargames of Kisa, Sweden.

Name: Warsaw Rising
Description:
This wargame depicts the struggle between the Polish patriots of the Armja Krajowa and the German garrison in 1944. The 120 units in the countermix include the Hermann Goring Division, SS Cossacks, and wire guided mini-tanks called Goliaths. The 23" x 17" map represents Warsaw and the suburbs on both sides of the Vistula River.

Combat can be affected by sewers, Stukas, and massive railway artillery pieces. The Poles must capture key locations to gather additional weapons from the Nazi occupation troops. The major Polish objective is to capture a bridge across the Vistula and link up their scattered froces.

Name: The Pre-Dreadnought Era 1870-1905
Description:
This is a naval combat game designed to recreate the tactics used in the transitional period of fleet actions that spanned the era between sail and steam.

The only scenario provided in the rules covers the decisive 1898 battle of Santiago during the Cuban Campaign. The designer suggests that players consult reference works like "Jane's Fighting Ships" to create additional scenarios. The battle system uses dice and hits are determined by armor thickness and the penetrating power of the projectile.

Includes a map, 60 counters, and a 24 page rule booklet.

Name: Battle For Rome: Anzio-Cassino 1944
Description:
This operational level WWII game shows all of the attempts to crack the German defenses in Italy from December 1943 to May 1944. The board covers the Anzio Beachead and the Gustav Line. The game includes full color maps and 420 die-cut counters. Contains several scenarios with a complete package of set-up sheets.

According to the game insert, only 100 copies of this game were made.

Name: Wehrmacht
Description:
Wehrmacht: The War in Russia 1941-1945.

This is an epic strategic level wargame of the entire campaign fought by Germany and the Axis partners against the Soviet Union. Includes 255 die-cut counters, a three-color map, and set up sheets for the various scenarios.

This zip-loc wargame was the first title published by Fusilier Games of Scotland.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Linebacker 2
Description: This is a strategic level wargame of the 1972 bombing campaign against North Vietnam. Includes one map and 150 counters. This game from Sweden originally appeared in issue #8 of "Combat" magazine.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Rush Hour U.S.A.: Atlanta Edition
Description:
The object of the game is to travel from work to your home neighborhood in Atlanta, collecting three different bartender business cards on the way.  Along the way, players must avoid the police (and a potential DUI) and roadblocks created by the Department of Transportation and the City of Atlanta.

The game contains six cars, six matching plastic chips (to mark the home neighbohood), 40 bar break cards, 80 highway risk cards, 80 numbered bartender cards, and two dice.

Published by Aggressive Enterprises, Inc.

(Taken from the enclosed rules sheet).

Name: Kokusai Sannin Shogi
Description:
Kokusai Sannin Shogi (International three-person chess) is a modern variant of Shogi (Japanese chess) for three players, created around 1930 by Tanigasaki Jisuke.

The game takes place on a board of 127 hexagonal cells. Each player controls a set of 18 pieces. The game allows for two players to enter an alliance against the third. If two players engage in a coordinated attack against the third, they are entered into an alliance automatically. The player not in an alliance gains a more powerful king piece and easier win conditions to counterbalance the alliance. As in other games in the chess family, the goal is to checkmate an opponent's king. A player not in an alliance need only checkmate one player to defeat both of them.

Unlike traditional games in the chess family, which have a thin military theme, kokusai sannin shogi has a thin political one, with pieces named after concepts such as public opinion, diplomacy and propaganda.

Incorporates information from: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sannin_shogi

Name: Jazz King
Description:
Tagline:
  "Hoping to use your eye for putting the right musicians together and counting on a bit of luck finding the right venues, you set out to create an empire of glitzy nightclubs, headline bands, and swinging music.  The city is wide open.  Welcome to Jazz King."

Jazz King is a Print & Play game of set collection and area control.  In order for a player to place a venue on the board they must collect the necessary musicians to fill the venue.  The more control a player exerts over a city block, via venues, the more points they earn.

Print & Play Components:
Game Board
Venue Tiles
Musician Cards
Event Cards

Additional Components for play: 
84 playing bits/cubes (21 cubes in four colors).

Name: Clara
Description:
Clara is abstract connection game similar to hex or twixt, but stones are placed (drawing) freely on board.

Similar as in hex or twist, players place stones (draw circle) on board and goal is connect oposite sides of board. Two near (max 2 diameters) stones are connected and connection is draw. Connections cannot be crossed. Stones cannot overlap.

Game can be played as paper and pencil game, but play on computer is far simpler. Length of game is dependent on size of stones (circles).

Version: Stones can overlap, but new stones (circles) are drawn under old circles.

Name: Watch Your Six: Aerial Combat in The Great War
Description:
Author: Michael J. Clinton

Squadron Level Air Combat Rules Aerial Combat in the Great War WATCH YOUR SIX ! is an in depth hex based game of squadron level air combat that took place on the Western Front during the Great War.
Emphasis is placed on outcomes rather than processes.
Unlike similar games, these rules were designed to allow a single player to handle multiple aircraft.
Pilot skill is just as important as the characteristics of the aircraft flown.
The WATCH YOUR SIX! rules are not a stand alone product.
Two sample aircraft and a single scenario are included in the rules set.

Expanded by YANKS!

Source: wy6 site: http://www.wy6.us)

Name: MERCENARY: Battle for City
Description:
Strategic board game, 2 armies of mercenaries are fighting for control of the city.

Players take on the 2 sides of the conflict. Struggle for dominance over each point of the city - buildings, special points, etc.

Players will acquire victory points for each building under their control.

The board represents the abandoned areas of cities. Attacking units will be coming up a city of eight pages. To realize there will be many missions and scenarios prepared for the modes: standard deathmatch, capture the region, capture the flag, deathmatch and cooperative.

Name: Mikado Reisspel
Description:
travel version of Mikado game; involves avoiding (or winning) colored little balls that will fall through after the Mikado stick have been pulled out of the stack. The stack is still kind of random, but is now fixed in a cilinder,that allows for playing on any surface (allthough playing in the back of a car might prove a bit difficult)

user sunmmary:
24 sticks are put through little holes in a cilinder, thereby creating some kind of 'net' blocking the opening of the cilinder. 17 blue balls and 1 yellow ball are poured over and are effectively blocked.
Then players may retreive a stick from the cilinder, 1 by 1, trying to avoid (or in a variant: to maximise) the number of balls falling through. The blue balls count for 1 and the yellow ball counts for 5 points. Balls lying on top of the stack of sticks may be manipulated when in the process of retreiving a stick, thereby forcing of preventing them from falling through.

It's a fun little game played by 2 to 4 players. Children like the colours and the balls falling through.

Name: DBACW: An ACW Supplement for DBA Rules
Description:
DBACW is an expansion for the WRG De Bellis Antiquitatis rules version 2.0 adapting the DBA mechanics to the American Civil War.  Ownership of the DBA rules are required.

While the system is designed as an expansion to DBA, there are grades for troop types ("Veteran", "Experience", and "Raw") and Generals ("Good", "Average" and "Poor"), which is more similar to De Bellis Multitudinus (DBM).  A typical army is a division composed of multiple brigades (each of which has its own commander).  Rules are also given for larger battles forming Corps sized units.

Scale:
Infantry element:  4-500 men
Cavalry element:  3-400 men
Artillery element:  8-12 guns
Ground scale:  1" = 100 paces (about 80 yards)

Name: Kleine Helden: Schurken & Halunken
Description:
The battle of little heroes continues, but now they get really evil: At this basic game you control rogues & scoundrels.
"Little Heroes - rogue & scoundrel" is a fast action card game.
Scenarios, evil deamons and 180 brand new card will bring you lots of fun in the world of little heroes!

This is a stand alone game, but of course you can combine it with the other games of little heroes for more fun.

Players each control a party of 2 different fantasy stereotype heroes (or scoundrels). They obtain cards which allow them to acquire equipment, potions and combat moves during the course of the game to help them try eliminating all other characters. The last hero still alive wins.

Name: Kingdom
Description:
Issue game of Game Link #2.
Designed by Yasutaka Ikeda.
Light card game of fantasy adventure.
Including characters, terrains, monsters, events, skills, items.

92 cards and tokens for characters, money, skills.

The game describes the characters' adventures in the world where the witchking controls.
Play actually proceeds with rolling dice and moving your character according to the roll then resolve the adventure card there.  The terrain and your skill will affect the adventure card.  You can get some money, item, or skill when you win the monster arose from the adventure card.

The character must collect 15 golds, or 3 emblems or eliminate the witchking to win the game.

Playable in an hour or so.

Name: Innovation Planner
Description:
From the publisher web site:

"Innovation Planner(TM) is a card set of innovation strategies and solutions used for rapid, effective, and efficient problem solving and idea generation. It is based on the Ideation TRIZ innovation methodology that was derived from the analysis of over 3 million patents and 500 standard patterns of technical evolution.  Just as you can combine the 26 letters in the alphabet to produce all ranges of literature, these cards describe the universal principles of invention that innovators combine to create the millions of inventions known to mankind.

You can use Innovation Planner(TM) for systematic innovation planning, brainstorming, or to play one of several innovation games.  Use of this product as directed leads to the creation of new and patentable inventions.  Inventors from using organizations have filed for dozens of patents inspired by the ideas on these cards, making these cards worth exponentially more than their weight in gold for the owning organizations."

See:  http://www.innovationplannercards.com/.

Innovation Planner represents a set of cards to aid in brainstorming.  The publishers also provide simple rules for two games, Solve It(TM) and Evolve It(TM), that utilize the cards.

In the games, a problem to solve is selected by players.  Players are dealt cards.  Each player plays a card on their turn.  When a card is played by a player, the player attempts to use the information on the card to address the problem.  The player then draws a new card.  Play continues until the cards run out or the problem is addressed to the satisfaction of the players.

The goal of the card set and games is to innovate novel solutions to known issues, or to generate inventive ideas, which might be patentable.

Name: The Last Stand: Italy, April '45
Description: "The Last Stand: Italy, April '45" is an operational wargame about the last month of World War II in Italy. One player is the German with some Fascist allies trying to delay allied advance toward the Po river. The other player has the composite forces of the Allies (American, British, Commonwealth, Polish, Jewish, Brazilian and Italian) with the objective to pierce enemy lines, catch significant cities and block retreat roads to the river and to Germany. Allies have a mighty airpower, while German has multiple defence lines with improved positions and a plenty of minor rivers. Rules reflect initial Hitler's strategy to hold until last man and, for the Allies, logistic problems to launch two main offensives at once; so German has initial movement limits and Allies must wait some game turns for their attacks: first the British Army,then the American Army.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Whirled Peas
Description:
In Whirled Peas, players compete in two teams in five types of interactive challenges, with the winner of each challenge earning a pea to fill its team pod. The first team to fill its pod wins. The challenges are:

• Putty Pal: Manipulate someone's body to act out the hidden word.
• Back Tracks: Draw an object on a teammate's back.
• Zip Your Lip: Get teammates to guess a word/phrase through charades and talking – but only talking through a closed mouth.
• Sketch Coach: Give drawing instructions to players on both teams and hope your team can guess the answer first.
• Clap Trap: One player from each team face off, giving answers to a category back and forth until one player falters. The other players clap. No, really.

Name: Darwin's Finches
Description:
On September 15 1835, HMS Beagle on its second surveying voyage arrived at the Galapagos Islands.  On board was a young geologist by the name of Charles Darwin.  Over the next five weeks, the ship visited four of the islands of the archipelago.   During these visits, Darwin collected 37 bird specimens he thought unique.  While traveling home, Darwin pondered the variations in beak size of the mockingbirds and finches he had collected.  These slight variations in beak structure, along with other small differences observed in both plants and animals he collected, were the beginnings of a radical new thought in how species came to exist.  Over the next fourteen years, Darwin expanded upon these ideas ultimately publishing his controversial treatise The Origin of Species in 1859.

In this game, players help four species of finch evolve and spread throughout the Galapagos archipelago from one common ancestor.  Species evolve and migrate as they try to dominate the habitable population centers on the islands.  Each species of finch has a preferred habitat, ground or tree, and preferred food source, insects or seeds.  Players can affect the dominate species by increasing the food source or habitat type of a particular species.  At the game end, the player who has the most valuable finch collection is declared the winner.

Name: Sprach-Schatz
Description:
Each player has a letter grid on a sheet of paper. The players roll dice and move onto letter squares on which they have to solve word puzzles (supplied on question cards). If they succeed, they can write the letter in any position in their grid. The goal is to fill the grid with four words across (different length as shown on the grid) and one down.
There are some fields on the board which allow players to erase letters when they wrote them in wrong positions.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: International Cricket
Description: Dice based cricket game, The box folds out into a cricket ground, and both players have an elastic band powered catapult they use to "throw" the dice into the box. With the dice results either resulting with runs scored or a wicket.

Name: Silly Switch Game
Description:
This is a Disney "Mickey Mouse Clubhouse" game for preschool children. It is designed for kids age 3 and older with no reading required. The game can accomodate up to four children who portray Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, or Donald Duck as they move around a colorful board.

A special die is used with colors instead of numbers. Players journey around the board as they learn colors, counting, taking turns, being required to stop during a move, and other basic skills.

Includes the board, 4 stand-up tokens, the special die, and rules.

Cardinal Item # 37169

Name: Battleground
Description:
Battleground is a card game of infantry combat in World War II. Simpler, but based on the old OOP Up Front by Avalon Hill.

Squad vs. Squad combat. Infantrymen are maneuvered via card play on a mapboard in fire teams. Terrain is placed via card play and are marked on the board with the terrain tiles during play. Cards are played to fire and a die is used for combat.

Components include:


    48 Cards
    28 Terrain Tiles
    42 Infantryman tiles
    4 National Characteristics cards
    1 17 x 33" mapboard
    12-page rulebook
    1 d6

Name: Pendulum of FATE
Description:
Also known simply as "Fate"; Pendulum of FATE is an acyclic two-player perfect information luckless abstract strategy game played on a grid of any size that starts out empty.  It can also be played on a hex grid.

Fate's most significant feature is the fact that players gain increasing tokens to place and use as the game progresses.  "Reinforcements" are calculated as a function of both the number of spaces the player already occupies at the start of his or her turn and the turn number of the game.  This increasing reinforcement calculation causes the dominance of the game to swing back and forth like a wild, accelerating pendulum, hence the name of the game.  The goal becomes timing the swings of the game such that a player is able to completely win the game before the momentum shifts right back.  The game is driven to a conclusion with one player filling the entire board and removing the final pieces of his or her opponent so only tokens of one color remain on the board.

Standard Pendulum of FATE is a two-player game, but it can also be played by more with additional supplies of theoretically limitless tokens in different colors for each player.

Name: The Tabloid News
Description:
The Tabloid News is the first in Warcoach Games new "10 Minute Game" series.  
   The Tabloid News is a new take on an old concept. Players make wild headlines that can even include custom cards with the players name and his friends on them. Never have tabloid lies been so much fun!!  In this game you can make the headlines, literally.
     To play the game, players lay down cards in order of color code from their hand to form a 5 card headline. The player to complete the headline gets all 5 cards and the points they are worth. Each card has it's own point value.  When the first person runs out of cards, or the draw deck is empty, the game is over.  The player with the most points wins.  Quick & easy.
     The game generally takes less than 10 minutes but provides hours of fun.  The first edition (called the Morning Edition) is out now.  A second edition is expected by fall (the Evening Edition).

(From the publishers release information.)

Name: The Battle of Modder River
Description:
This is a game about the November 1899 battle during the Boer War. A British force marching to relieve the siege of Kimberly ran into a force of Boers dug in along the banks of the Modder River and suffered heavy losses. The Boers were eventually outflanked and withdrew to another defensive position.

This was an amateur wargame published in Great Britain during 1981 by Yorkshire Games.

Name: Zoo Cards
Description:
Zoo Cards - "A tail for a head"

The game consists of a deck of 48 cards, each representing a quarter of an animal - head, front legs, back legs, or tail; the cards form 12 complete animals.

Rules are included for two games: Zoo Quartet, a version of [item:21389]; and A Head for a Tail.

A Head for a Tail is similar to Zoo Quartet, except that each player in turn offers to exchange one of his cards for one held by another player; the animal is not named, but the body parts offered and requested are, and the offer is made in general, not to any specific opponent. For example, "A tail for front legs!" or "Back legs for a head!" or the titular "A tail for a head!" The exchange is made with the first player to accept the offer. Play then passes to the left.

As players assemble a full set (one animal), called a "trick" in this game, they lay it in front of them. The winner is the first person to assemble a given number of tricks:


     Three players: 4 tricks
     Four players: 3 tricks
     Five players: 3 tricks (utilizing 3 spare cards in a kitty)
     Six players: 2 tricks

Name: What a Mouthful!
Description:
From the side of the box: Everyone is talking about the game that's a puzzle and the puzzle that's a game! Match the most mouths to their corresponding faces and win! Played alone or with friends, it's hilarious excitement while challenging visual discrimination and problem-solving skills.

From the instructions: Object of the game is to match the mouths with the faces.  All of the mouths are placed on the table.  Players or teams pick out three face pieces from the box and try to be the first to match the face pieces to the mouths. A round ends when a player or team matches all three.  New rounds continue until all faces and mouths are matched.

Name: Hospital
Description:
Hospital is a game of 2 to 4 players, which aims to become the new manager of the hospital. For it, we must know how to manage the money that our clients pay to us, equipping to the hospital of the best services as well as of the hiring of the best professionals. The player who obtains the greater number of points, will be the winner of the game.

Components
-1 board.
-48 counters (12 by player, 10 to mark the property of the dependencies, 1 for score and 1 for I+D).
-3 neutral counters (1 to mark the rounds in the clock of the time, 1 for the change with the bank and the last one for the rounds of the urgencies).
-28 cards of personages (7 by player).
-1 card of patron.
-40 counters of patients.
-23 counters of workers.
-40 coins (30 of 1 euro and 10 of 5 euro).
-1 card of initial player.
-1 dice of 6 faces.

This game is one of the finalists of the 2007 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creaciÃ³ de jocs.Since then, I think I've improved it.
source: game designer


Hospital es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores, que tiene como objetivo llegar a ser el nuevo gerente del hospital. Para ello, debemos saber gestionar el dinero que nos pagan nuestros clientes, dotando al hospital de los mejores servicios así como de la contratación de los mejores profesionales. El jugador que logre el mayor número de puntos, será el ganador de la partida.
-1 tablero.
-48 marcadores (12 por jugador, 10  para   marcar la   propiedad de  las dependencias, 1 para la puntuación y 1 para I+D).
-3 marcadores neutros (1 para marcar las rondas en el reloj del tiempo, 1 para el cambio con el banco y el último para las rondas de las urgencias).
-28 cartas de personajes (7 por jugador).
-1 carta de mecenas.
-40 fichas de pacientes.
-23 fichas de trabajadores.
-40 monedas (30 de 1 euro y 10 de 5 euros).
-1 carta de jugador inicial.
-1 dado de 6 caras.
 Este juego quedó finalista en 2007 en Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creaciÃ³ de jocs.(España) Desde entonces, creo que le he mejorado.

Name: Tannhäuser Revised Edition Rulebook
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The year is 1949, and the first World War rages on. The forces of the Union strive to end the conflict through the use of advanced technology, created from the alien wreckage discovered at Roswell. Their foes are the Reich. Headed by the occult powered Kaiser, this army of evil scours the globe for ways to enhance their prodigious occult abilities. Squads of the possessed sweep through Europe led by the Marquis General, Hermann Von Heïzinger.

What’s more, recent developments in the war have forced Mother Russia to enter the battle. Living embodiments of the reawakened Slavic gods, the Matriarchy is a deadly force to be reckoned with. Their robotic hordes are fueled with the genius of Tesla, and his electrical weaponry is easily the equal of the Union's technological advancements. The war is reaching a fever point... but which side will win?

Since its original release, Tannhäuser has engaged thousands of players with its deep narrative, innovative and intuitive mechanics, and action-packed gameplay. This spring, Fantasy Flight Games is improving on the strong foundations of this remarkable game system with the Tannhäuser Revised Edition Rulebook!

The Tannhäuser Revised Edition Rulebook improves upon the innovative mechanics of Tannhäuser. This 96 page perfect-bound book is intended as a comprehensive replacement to the original Tannhäuser rulebook; it includes revisions to the core game rules, as well as those originally found in the Operation: Novgorod expansion, along with the Wolf, Yula, Gorgeï, and Ramirez single figure packs.

In short, it includes all the rules players will need for any Tannhäuser product currently available. What’s more, players who already own a copy of Tannhäuser needn’t worry about their game becoming obsolete; the Tannhäuser Revised Edition Rulebook utilizes current Tannhäuser components, and requires no additional purchases!

Name: Runebound: Mists of Zanaga
Description:
Journey to a new and mysterious land. Explore the jungles and ruins of an ancient and forgotten civilization. Face the terrifying power of the primal gods. And be the first to restore balance to Zanaga...

Mists of Zanaga adds a colorful new board overlay, depicting the wild jungles and swamps of Zanaga. Six brand new heroes will be able to explore this new continent, uncovering the secrets of the makhim’s rituals, encounter wandering monsters, and hunt for the elusive Lost City. Adding all-new gameplay mechanics, a variety of primal gods to face, and over 165 new cards to bring this lush landscape to life, Mists of Zanaga creates a totally new way to play Runebound. Search out the secrets of the primal gods’ power and help summon them to free Zanaga from the clutch of Tarakhe.

Runebound: Mists of Zanaga is the fifth Big Box Expansion for Runebound: Second Edition.

You must own the Runebound basic game to play this expansion.

Name: Spinawina
Description:
A revolutionary new patented general knowledge quiz game for all the family.

Use your transport peg on the spinner to reach your destination i.e. the centre of the board first.  To do this, you need to answer questions correctly and collect your four tokens on route.
The spinner provides a novel and exciting way of playing the game and replaced the use of dice.

Name: Prime
Description: Each player begins with seven face-down cards, four of which he is allowed to peek at. A card will display one of the following prime numbers: 2,3,5,7,11,13,or 17. A round lasts seven turns. On each turn, a player either exposes one of his cards or exchanges it for a card that is in the draw deck or discard deck. The object is to collect the most primes without duplicating any. Scoring is based on the face values of the un-duplicated cards. Play a few rounds until a designated point total is reached. (User Summary)

Name: Bremen-Quiz
Description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the town of Bremen. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Syllaballistic
Description: This game is played in 3 or 5 minute rounds.  Players quickly write down a list of ten words that contain the corresponding word fragment like "tion" or "ous." The fragment can be found anywhere within the word.  Within a time limit, players write down a word for each of the ten fragments.  Players score points if no other player has the same answers, and it based on the number of syllables in your word. You earn one point per syllable. Score the most points to win the game.

Name: Gems of Virtues
Description:
There are 37 virtues that can be connected by a variety of paths across the game board. Each colored path represents one of the virtues associated with a Virtue card. Players try to score as many points as possible during the game by placing their colored gems between the virtues specified on their path cards.

Gems of virtues is a lightly themed route/network building game aided by path cards depicting routes that earn extra points and virtue cards that allow the player to build certain colored paths. Each player starts with 45 gems and attempts to link "virtues" such as Happiness and Beauty.

Gameplay ends when one player has less than 3 gems left at the end of their turn. Any remaining points are tallied, and the points on path cards that still exist in any player's hands are subtracted from their total.

Name: Voir Dire: The Game of Lawyers, Jurors, and Justice
Description:
Voir Dire is the legal name for the process by which attorneys select a jury to try a case.  Each party has the right to question potential jurors, try to understand their biases and the kinds of arguments that may be effective in reaching those jurors, strike potential jurors from the jury through the use of peremptory challenges, and then craft and focus an argument in an effort to win the selected jury to their cause.

In the game of Voir Dire, players are lawyers representing different parties attempting to influence a trial jury to decide in their favor.  This strategic game simulates the voir dire process and allows the players to bluff, plan, and manipulate the jury toward their desired outcome for the case.

Voir Dire is played by two players and takes about ten minutes per game.

Name: Civil War Battlefield
Description:
YOU are the general today. YOU command the infantry, send out the cavalry and position the cannon. YOU decide to fight, attack, retreat or defend. Our "battlefield" series offers easy to learn rules and simple strategy for all ages. (From the game insert.)

Players take turns rolling dice and moving their troops around the board. Using railroads or Shenandoah Valley can speed movement of tenacious infantry, mobile cavalry, and defensive cannons around the Eastern theater of war. Once three strategic objectives are achieved players can close in on their opponent's capital. Winning an infantry battle over the enemy capital wins the game.

Name: Baseball: Approved by Little League for Little Leaguers and Their Fathers
Description:
The game is designed to teach baseball to people of all ages, allowing them to make decisions similar to those made in an actual game.  To quote the introduction, "This is the only game approved by the Little League for Little Leaguers... It can be played with easy rules for beginners, so that dad can have fun teaching his boy the fundamentals of Baseball.  It can also be played using all the science and strategy of Major League Baseball."

The game consists of a field with a giant "spinner" embedded under it.  There are nine fielders sitting over small squares on the board, four umpires over additional squares, and a batter.  The knob in the center is spun and aligned to a space in front of the pitcher.  The player at bat then decides to swing, bunt or take the pitch.  If the pitch is taken, the umpire behind the plate will call a ball or strike.  This is done by lifting the umpire off a small square revealing the call.  If a swing is made, the batter is lifted off his square and the result of the swing is shown by a number 1-9 (indicating the player position) and the type of hit (ground ball, line drive or fly ball).  The defensive player then lifts the indicated fielder off his square to reveal whether the ball was fielded or not.  If a throw has to be made to a base, the umpire on that base makes the call.  If a runner gets on base, there are red base runners to indicate which base is occupied.  You can attempt steals, bunts, hit-and-run -- all the regular plays in baseball are available.  In addition, all the symbols are printed on the game board in foul ground so its easy to play without looking things up all the time.  A great, simple game that actually plays somewhat like the real thing.

(Quotes and description from rules printed inside the box lid.)

Name: Stockery
Description:
(Publisher Blurb)
The stock market started and stock prices move up-and-down. You can profit from the market simply by buying low and selling high. But watch the transaction fee which can significantly eat into your profit. You can also earn income through dividend issued by companies you are holding and other investment opportunities available in the market. However, you should not over-invest because you may need urgent cash to support your expenses. Being the major shareholder also allows you to exploit the cash reserve of the company to benefit yourself. The person who can obtain the maximum wealth at the end of the game is the winner.

This is a stock market game in which the players buy and sell stocks in 5 companies.  Stock prices fluctuate according to the market position which is driven by a die roll.  Each company's stock behave very differently.  Event cards trigger the paying of dividends,  right issues, share allotments, and such.  Each company also accumulates a cash reserve which is split among its shareholders at game end (or sooner if the company becomes privatized).

This is an original game designed and published in Hong Kong.

Name: Aliens in Antarctica
Description: You and your fellow penguins need to travel accross Antartica, collect enough Patagonian Tooth fish, fish eyeballs, and Krill to build the Great Pyramid. Do this without being eaten or having the fishermen beat you to the supply! You pray that one day the Aliens will come and rid the land of the evil fishermen and rest assured they will come to your aid.  Will you be the penguin that contributes the most to the great pyramid to win the game?

Name: ASL Classic
Description:
From the introduction :

The Avalon Hill Game company's Classic ASL is devoted to the presentation of authoritative articles and tested scenarios for the Advanced Squad Leader game system, wargaming's premier tactical simulation.

Classic ASL is a collection of articles, variants, analysis and scenarios for Avalon Hills Advanced Squad Leader game.

The first 10 scenarios are updated ASL versions of Squad Leader Scenarios and the other 6 are new tournament scenarios.

From the Table of Contents:

Squad Leader Clinics
    Tips to Better Your ASL Play by Jon Mishcon

From the Editors
    Why Classic ASL? by The Editors

1987 ASL Tournament
    The Greatest Tournament Scenarios Ever? by Jon Mishcon and Joe Suchar

One-Half FP
    The Incremental IFT Variant by Jay Kaufman

First Impressions
    Advanced Squad Leader: Infantry Training by Robert Medrow

Broken Swords
    Minor Neutral Powers in ASL by David Meyler

Scenario Analysis-Dead of Winter
    An Analysis of a Tournament Classic by Jim Stahler

Scenarios in this Issue:

A The Guards Counterattack
B The Tractor Works
C Streets of Stalingrad
D Hedgehog of Piepsk
E Hill 621
F Paw of the tiger
G Hube's Pocket
H Escape from Velikile Luki
I Buchholz Station
J The Bitche Salient
T1 Gavin Take
T2 The Puma Prowls
T3 Ranger Stronghold
T4 Shklov's Labors Lost
T5 The Pouppeville Exit
T6 Dead of Winter

Name: Kaleidos: 2009 Expansion
Description:
The Kaleidos: 2009 Expansion, which was available only at Spiel 2009, includes four new pictures for the "Cocktail game/Ystari" edition of Kaleidos. The images each depict a scene packed (to greater and lesser extents) with various objects.

In Kaleidos, each of up to four players or teams uses identical scenes and a deck of cards provides a letter for the round. Everyone gets sixty seconds to write down as many things beginning with that letter as they can find in the scene. Once time has expired, any object on multiple lists scores one point for those who wrote it. Any item unique to a single list scores three points.

Name: Shaun das Schaf: Echt Schaf!
Description:
User Summary:
The pigs have made a mess of Shaun's photo album. The players help Shaun gather up his pictures as fast as possible, so that the farmer doesn't find out.

60 playing cards are spread randomly face down over the table. Every card's front has one of four sheep pictured and a background in one of four colours. Players pick up and look at cards as fast as possible (no turns) and then either return them to the table or place them on their pile. The game ends when there are no cards left to pick up. Players score points for the longest sequence in their pile where no two adjacent cards share either the picture or the background.

Name: Grody
Description:
ENG:
Go back over  1000 years in time when the area of present-day Polish territory was divided between great tribes. Each of these tribes were concentrated around the centers of power - fortified castles. Lead one of the tribes, defend against enemy attacks, conquer  the vast territories and finally try to conquer rival's stronghold. Probably you will have to fight many battles in which many brave fighters will fall.
"Grody" (Castles) is a strategy game for 2 players. In this title you will find a nice mix of realm building controlling conquered territories to gain Victory Points and dice based combat. Each player becomes the ruler of the castle, Sielec or Szczukczyn, and seeks to gain territorial dominance or raise the opponent's castle.

PL:
Cofnij siÄ™ o ponad 1000 lat w czasy, gdy obszar dzisiejszej Polski podzielony byÅ‚ na terytoria wielkoplemienne. KaÅ¼de z tych plemion skupione byÅ‚o wokóÅ‚ oÅ›rodków wÅ‚adzy - warownych grodów. StaÅ„ na czele jednego z plemion, obroÅ„ go przed zakusami wrogów, opanuj i zagospodaruj rozlegÅ‚e terytoria, wreszcie spróbuj podbiÄ‡ gród rywala. Zapewne bÄ™dziesz musiaÅ‚ stoczyÄ‡ wiele bitew, w których polegnie niejeden dzielny woj.
“Grody” to strategiczna gra planszowo - karciana dla dwóch osób. KaÅ¼dy z graczy staje siÄ™ wÅ‚adcÄ… grodu, Sielca lub Szczukczyna, i dÄ…Å¼y do zdobycia dominacji terytorialnej lub podbicia grodu przeciwnika.

Name: Transformech
Description:
ENG:
Transformech is a card game for 2 players.  It simulates a fight between two battle robots (Transformechs), which are designed by players and transform the during game, adapting to changing game conditions. The goal is to destroy opponent's T-mech's Central Control Module.

PL:
Transformech jest grÄ… karcianÄ… przeznaczonÄ… dla 2 osób. Symuluje walkÄ™ dwóch robotów (Transformechów), które sÄ… konstruowane przez graczy, i które przeobraÅ¼ajÄ… siÄ™ (transformujÄ…) w trakcie rozgrywki, dostosowujÄ…c siÄ™ do zmieniajÄ…cych siÄ™ warunków w grze. Celem gry jest zniszczenie ModuÅ‚u Centralnego Sterowania Transformecha (w skrócie Tmecha) przeciwnika.

Name: Klussen met Koeien
Description:
"Klussen met Koeien" is a humoristic card game from The Game Master which is called "Handy Cows" in English.
The game can roughly be translated as "Renovating with cows" or "Total Make over".

Just like the earlier "Koe zoekt Boer" (Happy Cows) it is inspired on realty TV shows. In this game the inspiration is found with Home Make-over programs.

The cows have big plans with the farm.  Bertha, Gretha, Johanna, Jacoba en Klara search the best bulls who have the best tools to do the job. Of course the girls like a bull with heavy tools. But the bulls are nowhere in sight when the heavy works begins. It's time to search for the bulls to get them in action.

In this game you are the foreman who has to keep the bulls at work. Bulls with heavy tools give high victory points, but they have several weaknesses. Some of the bulls are not "doing it" in a safe way. Other bulls are lazy, hungry, noisy, bull shitters or not very smart or handy.

The game works as a standalone but can be combined with "Koe zoekt Boer" (Happy Cows) and "Gooishe Koeien" (Trendy Cows).
There also is a special card that is an expansion to "Koe zoekt Boer". This is the Power Bull, which allows you to take over a turn of another player. This way turning the nice teasing game Koe zoekt Boer in a really nasty party game.
Families: Series: Kaarten met Koeien (The Game Master BV)

Name: Gooische Koeien
Description:
Gooische Koeien is a parody on a dutch TV program that is a bit like the tv show: "Footballers Wifes".

It is the third part of the set: "Koe zoekt Boer" en "Klussen met Koeien".  Just like the others it is a stand alone game but it can be combined with the others.

In "Gooishe Koeien" the cows now have a beautifull mansion and they now want a wealthy bull that buys them lots of designer presents.  The cows love shopping and they don't do anything else, besides that they also have a playbull but you have to watch out that you are not seen with something fake.
Families: Series: Kaarten met Koeien (The Game Master BV)

Name: Period 5
Description:
Period 5 is a strategy game whose underlying mechanic is based on a juggling notation called siteswap.

Pieces: All pieces are able to move orthogonally as far as they wish until they either come to the edge of the board or meet another piece.  Each player controls 4 of their own pieces.  There is also a cube which both players may control.

Setup: The cube is in the center. Player A's pieces go on one side of the center diagonal as to occupy only one color and Player B's pieces go respectively onto the other.

Play: Players take turns moving either their own piece or the cube. When the cube is moved somewhere the next player may not move it back to the place where it was moved from.  One may not move the cube while their opponent is ("in check") threatening to win on their next move.

Winning conditions: The player who gets all of their pieces plus the cube onto different colors and simultaneously into different columns (not meaning rows) wins.

Name: World of Transport
Description:
Players build their company and fleet communication. The game is practically free of randomness. Everything depends on the player.

Who will win the most markets, and export the most? Board game with world of production and transport.

Phases of a player's turn:

     Determine Market Prices
     Building City (auction houses between players)
     Building Transport Fleet
     Trade (sales of raw materials)
     Transport
     Export


Players produce raw materials, which could trade among themselves, or export it and earn money.

Victory:
Victory points are scored for the export of each product and for the buildings.

Name: Drupal: The Card Game
Description:
"Building a website is not an easy task! But if you choose Drupal as your framework, you can work together with many others to make the job easier for everyone.

"In this quick card game 2-4 players compete to earn the most reputation by developing new Drupal modules and building complex websites!" [source: rule book]

---

This card game adopts the theme of building a rich and dynamic website (i.e Web 2.0) using Drupal, open source and free software used for building content management sites (e.g. WhiteHouse.gov, PopularScience.com).

In the real world, software developers create and contribute to "modules" that website builders can add to their core Drupal site, extending its features and functionality.

Players start by playing cards representing modules (i.e. simultaneous action selection) and then build up their own contributions to those modules (i.e. turn-based play, auction/bidding) with points on colored cards representing each player. These are referred to as "patch cards," since developers fix a module by patching its code.

Players must contribute enough patch cards to make a module available to any player (i.e. cooperative play) to eventually build a website. They can also "own" that module by being its biggest contributor.

Finally, players try to build websites for victory points depending on whether a module is available and its color (e.g. pink, blue or brown). Victory points are also available for individuals who contribute the most to a module's development. The winner has the most victory points. Play lasts 5-10 minutes.

The design of the cards is unique in that modules and websites are combined on the same card, on either side, and the websites have the URL for well-known sites using Drupal.

The order of play is as follows:

1. Take 7 patch cards
2. Take 6 site/module cards
3. Play 3 modules
4. Play patches on modules
5. Audit modules
6. Sites check
7. Module check
8. Score

The game is under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.

Name: Bayern-Quiz
Description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German state of Bavaria. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

--user summary by HilkMAN

Name: Chesapeake 1781
Description: Chesapeake 1781 is a scenario for Master and Commander v. 2 and is based on the rules found in that game. The first in a planned series, this scenario simulates the naval battle that took place September 5, 1781 between French and British fleets off Chesapeake Bay. The British under Cornwallis were under siege in Yorktown. A British fleet of 19 ships under Rear Admiral Thomas Graves sailed to Chesapeake Bay to relive Cornwallis. He was met by 24 French ships of the line under under the Comte de Grasse.

Name: Newfoundlandia III: The Photo Game
Description:
Would you recognize John Crosbie from a photograph? Could you identify Joe Batt's Arm? Do you know what barnacles look like? Each photograph tests your knowledge of a Newfoundland location, personality, or cultural item.

Contains OVER 200 PHOTOGRAPHS for you to identify. Photos are in four different categories: Arts & Culture, People & Politics, History & Geography, and Townie Trivia. Suitable for two or more players (or teams) ages 7 to adult. Ideal for the car, cottage, or classroom.

-(from the box cover)

Name: The Second World War
Description:
The Second World War is a grand-strategic, historical simulation game about World War II. Players represent the major powers involved in the conflict and have at their command the forces with which to wage war and achieve victory for their country or alliance.

The game covers the European, North African, and Pacific Theaters on three maps and four counter-sheets.

Difficulty is rated at a 6 out of ten, ages 12 and up.

Design Notes:
The Second World War was prototyped by Peter Bertram and Randall Mac Innis in 1985. It was originally envisioned as a medium-complexity wargame to fall somewhere between the existing designs, Axis and Allies and World in Flames, which were either too pedestrian for us hard-core, grognard wargamers or too massive to be played within the confines of our housing. This final version is exactly what we envisioned when we started: a fun game about WWII with a lot of meat, but not so complicated that you need to be an accountant to enjoy it.

The game scale, the 3-map composition, and the use of megahexes to regulate naval movement were originally set by Peter and Randall. They are the only elements that remained intact throughout development. While designer John D. Powers had to make many trade-offs between realism and playability, the latter was the primary concern. Once the nuances of the system are understood and exploited by all players, you will find that historical strategies will yield surprisingly historical results.

I hope that players find it to be enjoyable, and despite its high-level, granular view, the most accurate grand strategic game about WWII yet to be published.

What You Get

     2 22x34 inch full color maps
     1 17x22 inch full-color map
     4 Full-color, die-cut sheets of 5/8 inch counters
     1 Book of Rules
     1 Book of Scenarios
     Charts and Tables
     Dice


(source: One Small Step website )

Name: Snelrekenspel
Description:
The game-master throws the three blue dice. The numbers on these dice are the target number. Then he/she throws the six white dice and turns the hourglass over. The other players now have to add, subtract, divide and multiply and try to approach the number of the blue dice using the numbers on the white dice.
The company logo of Nationale Nederlanden counts as 100. Each number can only be used once. 
It is allowed to use pen and paper. The players get 6,5,4,3,2,1 points. If the blue number is reached the points are doubled. Then the next player is the game-master, untill every player has been the game master. 
The player with the most points wins the game.

Contents:
- 3 blue dice
- 6 white dice
- 1 hourglass + base

Name: Decalogue: The Ten Commandments Game
Description:
Decalogue is based on the events that took place in four books of the Bible: Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy. The object of the game is to collect and keep all Ten Commandments Tablets and cross the River Jordan into the Land of Canaan. Players roll dice and move around a board, taking the actions prescribed by the spaces they land on.

The game provides a unique and educational way to interact with other players while learning about the faith, offerings, plagues, and blessings of the Old Testament.

(user summary)

Name: Operation Sea Lion
Description:
Operation Sea Lion is available on the issue nº 49 of the spanish miniatures magazine "Wargames, Soldados y Estrategia".

Its a small wargame that simulates a "what if?" invasion of Great Britain by the German forces in September 1940.
The board is sized as an A4 page (29,7x21 cm) with the counters on another page the same size.

The counters represent mostly Divisions, but a few Brigades and Battalions are also available.
Sea and Air units, as well as other counters (mines, damage, etc) are available as well.

The game is an easy to play and rather simple one, even for its size, with a very simple naval and air phases, and combat mechanics.

The board and counter pages are included in the magazine, and the rules can be downloaded on its site. (see link, below)

Name: Spellen-Meister
Description:
A roll of the die determines a set of two letters. Within the allotted time, players write down words that include the two-letter combo. The combo may occur at the beginning or the end of a word or somewhere in between, with more points awarded for the latter variety.

(user summary)

Name: Jungle Bungle!
Description:
from the back of the box

All hell is breaking loose in the jungle! Somebody has stolen the monkeys' treasure - and you have to find it! Help the monkeys and find your way trough the jungle with the magnetic treasure detector. If you hear a "clack!", you have found the treasure. The player who finds the most gems and brings them to the king of the monkeys wins the game!


Help the apes find the stolen treasure!

Players roll the banana dice to move the magnetic treasure hunter on the board, trying to find the missing gems located under the board. When the treasure hunter moves on top a gem, it attaches to the magnet. The players then try retrieve the gem by moving the hunter to the hole in the middle of the board. Gems are scored based on their colors.

Name: Romulan Armada
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Next Invasion!

Expanding our Starmada line, the Romulans invade the Federation. This includes rules to bring 40 Romulan, Gorn, and Federation ships into the popular Starmada game system, along with plasma torpedoes, cloaking devices, and those sneaky Romulan privateers.

This 90-page book includes the Essential Starmada rules so it's ready to play without buying or downloading anything else, but Romulan Armada is designed to work with other Starmada products including Klingon Armada.

Integrates with:

    Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
    Klingon Armada
